222781.content:
"I am living, because the God has some reason

  To keep me alive

  And it never comes back

   Shecky Turkovich

223148.content:
In the fiery gust

Led by fierce battles

A warrior has torched

The village, birthplace of his own

A son from his mother's arms

Was taken by a brute

Now he curses his destiny

That he's a janissary

At the hearth of a bleak house

An old woman was crying

He raised the saber above her head

The pillaging warrior

Oh, don't you raise your hand against me

Oh, if you grief is known

For I am your mother

I recognized the birthmark that resides above your lip

The young janissary dismounts

He drops his saber, his bridle as well

The mother was about to speak

But utters not

244578.content:
Sunday, 28th of August

three-thirty o clock

weather in the city is sunny and warm

traffic is heavy and slow

radio love

wishes you a pleasant day.

Black sunglasses, white flower in the pocket

and goodbye letter known by heart

in both hands candles, tear shines in the eye

someone has died, that someone is me

I didn't survive your infidelity,

somebody having what's mine

oh, shall your body be desecrated

by foreign hand

I didn't survive that you are pulchritudinous,

even more than when you were mine

oh, shall your lips be kissed

by foreign lips

I died for you

I died and you didn't

cry for me

And there is a myriad of reasons around me 

to be alive again and joyful

Ladies in red dresses are walking

the birds are chirping, everything is bothering me

Adolf son of Luke
